TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Reminders implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook._Reminders, class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.ReminderCollectionEvents_Event

Docs.summary: Contains a collection of all the objects in a Microsoft Outlook application that represent the reminders for all pending items.

remarks.para: This is a .NET interface derived from a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this derived interface to access all method, property, and event members of the COM object. However, if a method or event you want to use shares the same name under the same COM object, cast to the corresponding primary interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Refer to this topic for information about the COM object. For information about the method and property members of the COM object, see . For information about the event members of the COM object, see .
Use the object's property to return the Reminders collection. Use Reminders(), where is the name or ordinal value of the reminder, to return a single object.

Reminders are created programmatically when a new Microsoft Outlook item is created with a reminder. For example, a reminder is created when an object is created and the AppointmentItem object's property is set to True.
